page.title: 21Gnosall Fire Station
page.content:
Gnosall Fire Station is a Retained Fire Station serving Gnosall and outlying villages.

Fire fighters must live with a 5 minute response time of the station and are then given 5 minutes to change into under-rigg and fire kit and turn out to incident. The appliance is usually on route to incident within 8 minutes.

Fire fighters carry an alerter which flashes, beeps and vibrates to alert them to respond to station. A print-out from Control gives them their incident, instructions and map reference.

There must be a minimum of 4 fire fighters on duty to "ride the pump", 2 BA (breathing apparatus) in the back, an OIC (Officer in charge) and the driver who usually becomes "pump-man".

Drill (training) night is once a week.

Fire fighters are commonly called out to chimney fires, road traffic collisions and farm/farm equipment/barn fires as well as property fires and animal rescues.

Gnosall Fire Station was built in 1967 and is currently undergoing refurbishment due for completion July 2011
